alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Franklin and southern Lawrence Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1000 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Phil Campbell, or near Haleyville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moulton, Phil Campbell, Mt Hope, Spruce Pine, Bankhead National Forest, Wren and Landersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northwestern Alabama.
